9.22.19  9:19 pm   9.21.19  1:36 pm

hmm. I think if god had to be created, than he wouldn't be god. The question "who created god" assumes that god had to be created. I think he would have to be outside of creation.

I don't think god is stuck in time, space, and matter, like we are.

Humans created computers but they are not bound by the rules that the computers are bound by, like ram, gb storage,etc. Humans are not stuck in the computer. They're outside of the computers. But even humans flaws. A god would be flawless.

The concept of a "god" is so difficult to even wrap around our head.

And if you do find out there is a god, the next question is, which one's the right one?
